chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruthann E. GNEISER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to comply with all terms of the CHIPS orders in case no: 14 JC 53 and 14 JC 54.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. Physical Abuse of Child, contrary to Section 948.03(3)(c) and 1 ct. Physical Abuse of Child - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm, contrary to Section 948.03(2)(b).
No contest pleas to the amended charges.  Convicted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 09-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Report to be filed by 08-31-15.  Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Letter from DA LaBre to the Court regarding negotiations.
State's 2nd Motion in Limine

Court explains defendant's right to a jury trial.   
Defendant wishes to waive her right to a jury trial.  
Court finds defendant's waiver is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.   
Court informs the parties that this matter is in the No. 1 position.   
Minutes.

Jury trial is reset to 07-15-16 and 07-16-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 2 position.
Status conference and motion hearing is set for 06-26-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Minutes.
Letter from DA LaBre consenting to waiver of jury trial.
Copies of letters dated 10-09-14 and 11-04-14 with medical records of victim attached.

Defendant's Motions in Limine.
Cover Letter.

Attorney Hahn filed a motion in limine yesterday and is asking that they be heard today. Motion will not be heard today.
The defendant is requesting a trial to the court instead of a jury trial.  The State needs to consent to a waiver of a jury trial before the court can do so.  Attorney LaBre just got this information yesterday and would like some time to consider it before making a decision.
Motion hearing is set for 05-01-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Jury trial is now in the no: 1 postion for  05-06-15.
Minutes.
Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Cover letter.
State's Motion in Limine.
State's Witness List.

Order Modifying Conditions of Release.  
It is hereby ordered that the bond originally imposed by the Court and subsequently modified on October 27, 2014, December 9, 2014, and January 2, 2015 is further modified to permit the defendant to have supervised contact with L.O.G., date of birth 01-13-2009, at the discretion of the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  All other conditions set forth in the Court's Order of October 27, 2014, December 9, 2014, and January 2, 2015 shall remain the same unless specifically modified by the terms of this Order.   
Cover Letter.

Jury trial set for 05-06-15 at 8:30 a.m. Position No. 2.
Pre-trial conference set for 04-23-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Court directs Attorney Hahn to prepare a proposed order as to what he believes should be imposed from the Torrison e-mail and submit it to the Court and the State. 
Minutes.
Letter from Attorney Hahn with attached e-mail from Christy Torrison.

Order Modifying Conditions of Release.
It is hereby ordered that the bond originally imposed by the court and subsequently modified on 10-27-14 and 12-09-14 is further modified to permit the defendant to have supervised, face to face visits with her son. MJG, DOB: 04-29-2009, at locations and at the discretion of the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  Phone contact with LOG, DOB: 01-13-2009, may occur more than one time per week if permitted by the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  All other conditions set forth in the court's order of 10-27-14 and 12-09-14 shall remain the same unless specifically modified by the court.
Cover letter.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to suppress statements is hereby denied.

Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Statements of the Defendant.
Cover letter with attachment.

MOTION TO SUPPRESS STATEMENTS - 
The Court has reviewed the DVD of the interview.
EXHIBIT 1, DVD of interview between Lt. Colborn and defendant, marked.
Testimony presented.
The Court comments and denies the motion to suppress.
State to draft order.
MOTION TO MODIFY BOND  -
There is a facility in Sheboygan that the parties would like to use for visitation purposes because it is closer.  The Court has no objection to the site of visitation being determined by Human Services.
There is a school function for one of the children today that the defendant would like to attend.  Human Services has already approved it.  The State has no objection as long as defendant is supervised by school staff.  Court will allow defendant to attend this school function.
Defense is asking that phone contact with the victim be changed to every other day instead of once a week.  The State objects to this motion being heard today because Attorney LaBre hasn't spoken with Human Services about this.  Attorney Hahn is asking that this contact also be regulated by Human Service.  The Court will allow this.
Attorney Hahn to draft the order as to the bail modifications.
Minutes.

Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Statements of the Defendant.
Cover letter with attached email.

Order Modifying Conditions of Release.
It is hereby ordered that the bond originally imposed by the Court and subsequently modified on 10-27-14 is further modified to permit the defendant to have supervised, face to face visits with her son, MJG, DOB: 04-29-2009, to be held at the offices of the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  Face to fact contact may occur one time per week, or more, if permitted by the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  Phone contact is permitted with the defendant's sone, LOG, DOB: 01-13-2009, and may occur one time per week.  All other conditions set forth in the court's order of October 27, 2014 shall remain the same unless specifically modified by this court.
Cover letter.

The letter report from Dr. James Heider has been reviewed by the Court.
The defendant is requesting modification of the contact with the defendant's children.
Attorney LaBre objects to any modification.
Attorney Hahn argues.
The Court comments and will allow face to face contact with Micah once a week at Human Services and phone contact with Lucas will also be allowed once a week beginning immediately.
Attorney Hahn to draft the order.
Motion hearing is set for 12-19-14 at 10:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant.
Letter Report of James P. Heider Ed.S., Licensed Psychgologist.

Amended Order
It is hereby ordered that the bond originally imposed by the Court on September 23, 2014 is modified to permit the defendant to have supervised phone contact with M.J.G., date of birth 04-29-2009, to be supervised by the defendant's parents, either Darrell or Martena Hause.  Phone contact between the defendant and M.J.G. may occur every other day with the first contact to be on October 22, 2014.  Darrell or Martena Hause shall monitor the phone calls and report to assigned social workers at the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  The bond conditions of the defendant shall be reviewed again on November 24, 2014 at 3:30 p.m.   
Cover Letter.

It is hereby ordered that the bond originally imposed by the Court on September 23, 2014 is modified to permit the defendant to have supervised phone contact with M.J.G., date of birth 04-29-2009, to be supervised by the defendant's parents, either Darrell or Martena Hause.  Phone contact between the defendant and M.J.G. may occur every other day with the first contact to be on October 22, 2014.  Darrell or Martena Hause shall monitor the phone calls and report to assigned social workers at the Manitowoc County Human Services Department.  The bond conditions of the defendant shall be reviewed again on November 24, 2014 at 3:30 p.m.

Social worker for Human Services makes an informational statement to the Court.  
Court believes supervised visitation is not appropriate at this time.  Court will allow phone contact with Micah, every other day starting on 10-22-14.  The calls are to be monitored by the grandparents to be reported to social workers.  
Review hearing set for 11-24-14 at 3:30 p.m.

Letter from Paulette Sears.

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.

Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 11-12-14 at 11:00 a.m.
Plea date is set for 02-11-15 at 10:00 a.m.

The parties comment.
The Court will set this issue for a review hearing on 10-21-14 at 10:30 a.m.  Hopefully the report will be done and more information received by then.

Information.

Order to Modify Bail. Denied.

Motion to Modify Condition of Bond.
Counsel argue.
Court denies the motion.
Notice of Petition and Petition to Modify Conditions of Release.
Notice of Appearance.

Defense counsel requests a hearing date on his motion regarding conditions of bail.  Motion hearing set for 10-02-14 at 3:30 p.m.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 10-15-14 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

At 3:22 p.m., $10,000.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of physical abuse of a child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-29-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with L.O.G., DOB: 01-13-2009 and M.J.G., DOB: 04-29-2009 and no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
